sentences: P체체ab lamades leida k천ige mugavamat asendit.
context: The Estonian adjective 'mugav' means comfortable, pleasant or cozy. It can describe physical comfort (like a comfortable bed or chair), a pleasant situation (having a nice evening), or even refer to someone who is easygoing or avoids effort ('mugav mees'). The word changes form depending on case and number: mugav (nom. sg.), mugavad (nom. pl.), mugavat (part. sg.), mugavaid (part. pl.).
